cause.description:
The Foundation for Post Conflict Development was formally incorporated in New York on April 25, 2005 as a not-for-profit organization that seeks to offer assistance to countries emerging from conflict situations.
1. EDUCATION: Make the public aware of the special needs of countries emerging from post conflict situations.
2. ACTION: Take direct action through fundraising and project management to improve conditions in these countries.
3. DEVELOPMENT: The foundation helps relieve suffering and builds healthier communities, while helping these communities become better equipped to educate themselves, ensuring a more peaceful and prosperous future.
cause.mission: assisting post conflict countries with projects necessary for their social and physical reconstruction.
cause.name: Foundation for Post Conflict Development
